meanings.definition: Formed into small, loose clusters or clumps.
meanings.sent1: The flocculated clouds drifted lazily across the sky.
meanings.sent2: The artist used flocculated paint to create a textured effect on the canvas.
meanings.sent3: The flocculated sheep looked like fluffy cotton balls bouncing around the field.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were flocculated, making it hard for her to focus on one idea.
meanings.sent5: The flocculated snow on the branches sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To cause (particles) to aggregate into clusters or clumps.
meanings.sent1: The detergent flocculated the dirt particles in the water, making them easier to remove.
meanings.sent2: Stirring the mixture slowly will flocculate the ingredients together.
meanings.sent3: The chef flocculated the ingredients in the pot, creating a delicious stew.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to flocculate the cards into a perfect deck with a wave of his hand.
meanings.sent5: The music flocculated the crowd into a dancing frenzy.

meanings.definition: Having particles that have aggregated into clusters or clumps.
meanings.sent1: The flocculated sediment settled at the bottom of the jar.
meanings.sent2: The pond water appeared flocculated due to the presence of algae clusters.
meanings.sent3: The flocculated sand on the beach made it difficult to walk smoothly.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was flocculated with glitter after the craft project.
meanings.sent5: The flocculated powder in the air created a hazy atmosphere in the room.
